video_caption: The video begins with a whiteboard displaying the title "Strategic Planning using Research & Analysis" and a magnifying glass labeled "RESEARCH" in the top right corner. An arrow points to the right, leading to the words "QUALITATIVE & QUANTITATIVE" in bold letters, emphasizing the importance of both types of data in strategic planning. The scene transitions to a signpost with two arrows labeled "THIS WAY?" and "THAT WAY?" representing the decision-making process in planning. A group of diverse individuals stands in front of the signpost, symbolizing the audience or stakeholders involved in the planning process. A woman in a yellow shirt and black skirt, holding a clipboard, appears to be explaining something to a man, indicating a discussion or presentation. The video then zooms in on the words "QUALITATIVE &/OR QUANTITATIVE DATA" with a magnifying glass, highlighting the focus on data analysis. The final scene shows a hand writing on a whiteboard with the title "Qualitative & Quantitative Research" and the subtitle "Learning goals for this video," indicating the educational purpose of the content. Throughout the video, the magnifying glass labeled "RESEARCH" remains a recurring visual element, reinforcing the theme of research and analysis in strategic planning.

The video features a whiteboard with the title "Qualitative & Quantitative Research" and a magnifying glass icon labeled "RESEARCH" in the top right corner. Below the title, the text "Learning goals for this video:" is displayed, followed by a graduation cap icon. A hand holding a black marker appears and begins writing on the whiteboard, starting with the question "What is the connection?" and then listing "Research, Analysis, Strategic Planning" as the connection. The hand continues to write, adding "Qualitative & Quantitative Research" and the word "WHAT?" underneath. The hand then writes "WHY?" and "HOW?" with the latter accompanied by "(pros & cons)" in parentheses. The video maintains a simple, educational atmosphere with a focus on the whiteboard and the hand's writing, emphasizing the learning goals and key concepts related to qualitative and quantitative research.

The video begins with a hand-drawn title slide titled "Qualitative & Quantitative Research," accompanied by a magnifying glass icon labeled "RESEARCH" and a list of learning goals. The scene transitions to a whiteboard with a signpost labeled "Strategic Planning using Research & Analysis," featuring two arrows pointing in opposite directions, one labeled "THIS WAY?" and the other "THAT WAY?" A hand holding a red crayon points to the signpost, followed by a hand-drawn rectangle with the text "SECONDARY & PRIMARY RESEARCH" inside. The video then shows a hand-drawn building with an arrow pointing towards it, labeled "INTERNAL," and a calculator and gears symbolizing internal processes. The scene shifts to a hand-drawn map of the United Kingdom with an arrow pointing towards it, labeled "EXTERNAL," and a hand-drawn icon of a flexed arm labeled "ETC." The video concludes with a hand-drawn icon of a stack of papers with a magnifying glass, labeled "DATA QUALITY VALIDITY & RELIABILITY," and a hand-drawn icon of a light bulb with gears inside, symbolizing ideas and processes. Throughout the video, the "RESEARCH" magnifying glass icon remains in the top right corner, and the "VideoScribe" logo is visible in the bottom right corner.

The video features a hand-drawn diagram on a whiteboard, illustrating a strategic planning process. At the top, two directional signs read "THIS WAY?" and "THAT WAY?" pointing to different paths. Below, a large box labeled "SWOT" is connected to a smaller box with the word "SUMMARIZE" and an arrow pointing towards it. The SWOT box is divided into four quadrants, each representing Strengths, Weaknesses, Opportunities, and Threats. To the right, a section titled "RESEARCH" includes subcategories for "SECONDARY & PRIMARY RESEARCH," "QUALITATIVE & QUANTITATIVE RESEARCH," and "DATA QUALITY VALIDITY & RELIABILITY," accompanied by a stack of papers and a magnifying glass. Below, "EXTERNAL PEST PORTER'S 5" and "INTERNAL" are depicted with a map outline and a calculator, respectively. As the video progresses, the SWOT box is updated to include "TOWS" and "STRATEGIC OPTIONS," with arrows indicating the flow of information. The diagram remains static, with no people or movement, focusing solely on the strategic planning process.

The video begins with a title screen that reads "Planning using Research & Analysis," accompanied by a magnifying glass icon labeled "RESEARCH." The scene transitions to a hand-drawn illustration of a cityscape with a signpost featuring two arrows labeled "THIS WAY?" and "THAT WAY?" The focus then shifts to a detailed drawing of a café named "The French Café," complete with a blue door, windows, and outdoor seating. A speech bubble above the café states "PROBLEM: DECREASING SALES," indicating a challenge faced by the business. The video continues to show a chef character on the café's rooftop, looking concerned, with a thought bubble containing a sad face, a donut, and a cup of coffee, symbolizing the café's struggles. The final frame includes a graph with a downward trend, reinforcing the issue of declining sales. Throughout the video, the theme of strategic planning using research and analysis is emphasized, with the magnifying glass icon and the title screen reappearing to underline the importance of data-driven decision-making in addressing business challenges.

The video begins with a hand-drawn illustration of a French café, featuring a sign that reads "The French Café" and a problem statement "DECREASING SALES" with a downward graph. Above the café, a question is posed: "How could the French Café find out what the customers want?" A magnifying glass labeled "RESEARCH" appears, followed by the words "QUALITATIVE RESEARCH" written in orange. The scene transitions to a group of people sitting around a table, engaged in a discussion, with the text "FOCUS GROUP INTERVIEWS" appearing next to them. The video then shows the group with thought bubbles above their heads, indicating they are brainstorming ideas. The atmosphere is collaborative and focused on solving the problem of decreasing sales through qualitative research methods.

The video opens with an illustration of a French café, featuring a blue façade and a sign that reads "The French Café." A group of people is seated at a table outside, engaged in a discussion, with thought bubbles above their heads indicating their conversation. A woman in a yellow top and black skirt stands nearby, holding a clipboard, while a man in a white shirt and jeans stands opposite her, gesturing as he speaks. The text "QUALITATIVE RESEARCH" appears at the top, with "FOCUS GROUP INTERVIEWS" written below it. An orange pencil highlights the words "1-ON-1" and "IN-DEPTH INTERVIEWS," followed by a magnifying glass emphasizing "RESEARCH." The scene transitions to show the woman and man continuing their conversation, with the text "BLA.BLA.BLA" appearing in a speech bubble, indicating their dialogue. The magnifying glass now highlights "OBSERVE CUSTOMER BEHAVIOUR." The video then zooms in on the man, who is wearing glasses, as he stands with his hands on his hips, looking thoughtful. The final frame poses the question, "How could the French Café find out what the customers want?" with the answer "QUALITATIVE RESEARCH" written below, accompanied by the same illustration of the café and the people engaged in conversation. The video effectively uses visual elements and text to convey the importance of qualitative research methods in understanding customer behavior and preferences.

The video features an animated illustration of a French café with a blue façade and a sign reading "The French Café." The scene includes customers seated at tables, engaging in conversation, and a person standing outside the café. The video focuses on qualitative research methods to understand customer preferences, with text highlighting "Focus Group Interviews," "1-on-1 In-depth Interviews," and "Observe Customer Behavior." A hand holding a pen writes on a whiteboard, listing characteristics of qualitative research, such as "Open-ended questions," "Can't be quantified," and "Uncovers motivations, feelings, preferences." The video emphasizes the importance of qualitative research in understanding customer behavior and preferences, with a focus on the subjective nature of the data collected. The environment is lively and engaging, with a clear emphasis on the research process and its application in a café setting.

The video begins with an illustration of a two-story building labeled "The French Café," featuring a blue door and windows with blue frames. A signpost in front of the café displays two arrows pointing in opposite directions, labeled "THIS WAY?" and "THAT WAY?" respectively. A red sign on the left side of the building reads "PROBLEM: DECREASING SALES," accompanied by a downward-trending graph. A magnifying glass labeled "RESEARCH" appears in the top right corner, indicating a focus on investigating the issue. The scene transitions to a close-up of the café's upper story, with a banner reading "QUANTITATIVE RESEARCH" and a clipboard with a checklist labeled "QUESTIONNAIRE." The magnifying glass remains in the top right corner, emphasizing the research theme. The video then introduces a cupcake with a "NEW" label, suggesting a new product launch, and a pair of glasses, symbolizing observation. The text "EXPERIMENT" appears, followed by "HOW MANY NEW CAKES SOLD?" and "OBSERVATIONS," with examples such as "HOW MANY ENTER / WALK PAST?" and "ONLINE BOOKING - MEASURE INTERACTIONS." The final frame includes the text "WWW. Google Analytics," indicating the use of online tools for data collection. Throughout the video, the café's exterior remains consistent, with a woman standing in front of the café holding a menu, and the magnifying glass labeled "RESEARCH" remains a constant visual element, reinforcing the theme of research and data analysis.

The video features a hand-drawn illustration of a café named "The French Café" with a menu board and outdoor seating. The scene is divided into two sections: on the left, a list of methods for conducting quantitative research, including "Questionnaire," "Experiment," "Observations," and "Online Booking," each accompanied by relevant icons. On the right, a green crayon writes the word "CHARACTERISTICS" on a whiteboard, followed by a black marker listing the characteristics of quantitative research, such as "Can be counted / measured," "Closed-ended questions," and "Predefined answer options." The video concludes with the addition of "Can be representative and objective" and "Can't uncover in-depth / detailed response," highlighting the limitations of quantitative research. The background is a simple whiteboard, and the overall atmosphere is educational, focusing on explaining the concept of quantitative research in a visually engaging manner.

The video features a hand-drawn illustration of a French cafe with a blue door and windows, set against a white background. A hand holding a black marker writes the word "What" above the cafe, followed by a green crayon writing "QUANTITATIVE" in green and "QUALITATIVE" in orange, separated by "vs." The text "What is best?" appears above the cafe, and a magnifying glass labeled "RESEARCH" is shown in the top right corner. A large question mark is drawn above the cafe, and a whiteboard with the text "QUANTITATIVE vs. QUALITATIVE" is displayed below. Additional text boxes appear, asking "Information need?" and "IN-DEPTH, DETAILED INSIGHTS?" with corresponding icons. The video concludes with the text "REPRESENTATIVE, MEASURABLE DATA?" and "Available resources?" added to the whiteboard, emphasizing the comparison between quantitative and qualitative research methods.

The video begins with a whiteboard displaying the question "What is best?" at the top, with a magnifying glass labeled "RESEARCH" in the upper right corner. Below, a banner reads "QUANTITATIVE vs. QUALITATIVE," with two arrows pointing to the left and right, each labeled with different research goals: "REPRESENTATIVE, MEASURABLE DATA?" on the left and "IN-DEPTH, DETAILED INSIGHTS?" on the right. In the center, a box asks "Information need?" and "Available resources?" with icons of a clock, a money bag, and a group of people. The scene transitions to show a green and orange arrow labeled "COMBINATION" pointing to the center, indicating a blend of both research types. The next frame presents a whiteboard titled "Qualitative & Quantitative Research," listing "Learning goals for this video" with two checkmarks next to the goals: "What is the connection? Research, Analysis, Strategic Planning" and "Qualitative & Quantitative Research/Data - WHY? - WHAT? (pros & cons) - HOW?" The video then shifts to a whiteboard titled "Strategic Planning using Research & Analysis," with a hand writing "To learn more..." followed by "- RESEARCH, ANALYSIS & STRATEGIC PLANNING" and "- MARKETING RELATED SUBJECTS." Additional resources are listed, including a YouTube channel link and a book titled "Market Research & Statistics" by IFAARUP et al. (2019). The final frame shows a graduation cap icon above the whiteboard, emphasizing the educational context, with the same resources listed below. The video concludes with a call to action for further learning, reinforcing the importance of research, analysis, and strategic planning in marketing.
